question: <image 1>Which cell type is pictured?
description: The image shows a microscopic view of a blood smear. The central cell has a large, round nucleus with a dense, dark purple staining. Surrounding this central cell are several smaller cells with greenish-stained cytoplasm and small, round nuclei. The central cell's nucleus appears to be segmented, which is characteristic of certain types of white blood cells. The surrounding cells are likely red blood cells, which typically appear smaller and have no visible nucleus in a stained blood smear.
